    STUDENT AND TEACHER PROGRAMS
    University Night
    Tuesday, November 21, 5:30–8:30
    University Night is an opportunity for college and university students to visit the Art Institute absolutely free! Students and faculty members can enjoy both So the Story Goes and Charles Sheeler: Across Media. With food, music, gallery talks, and lectures, it's a great way to relax with friends while you explore these exhibitions.

    Register for this free event by calling 312-857-7182 or emailing unight@artic.edu with your name, school, and email address.


    PERFORMANCES
    Voices: Charles Sheeler
    October 19, at 12:00
    Fullerton Hall


    FAMILY PROGRAMS
    Drawing in the Galleries: Shape
    Explore shape through drawing activities inspired by Sheeler's paintings, drawings, and photographs.

    October 22 or 29
    10:30–11:30
    Ages 6–8 with an adult
    Kraft Education Center

    October 22
    2:00–3:30
    Ages 9 & up
    Kraft Education Center

    Family Workshop
    Tour the exhibition with a museum educator and then create your own work of art to take home!
    Saturday, November 4, 2:00–3:30
    Ages 6–12 with an adult


    Mini Masters: Shape and Color
    Learn about Sheeler’s work on a brief gallery visit and through stories, games, and hands-on art activities.

    Saturday, November 4 or 11
    10:30–11:30
    Ages 3–5 with an adult

    The Artist's Studio: Shape Factory
    Families and children of all ages will create a colorful collage inspired by modernist images of American industry on view in the exhibition.
    Saturdays and Sundays in December (except December 10, 24, 30, and 31).
    Drop in between 12:30 and 3:30
    All ages
